meanings.definition: A group of things of the same kind that are held or tied together
meanings.sent1: I picked a bunch of flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent2: She carried a bunch of keys on her keychain.
meanings.sent3: The bunch of balloons floated away in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The stars formed a bunch in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The bunch of bananas looked ripe and delicious.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things
meanings.sent1: A bunch of students gathered in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The bunch of grapes was sweet and juicy.
meanings.sent3: The bunch of puppies played happily in the park.
meanings.sent4: The bunch of books on the shelf caught my eye.
meanings.sent5: We saw a bunch of birds flying in formation.

meanings.sent1: I need to bunch up the curtains to let more light in.
meanings.sent2: She decided to bunch her hair into a ponytail.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to bunch up the fallen leaves for fun.
meanings.sent4: He managed to bunch the wires neatly behind the desk.
meanings.sent5: The fabric will bunch if you pull it too tightly.
